column1: '''Bagshot Row''' was the row of [[Hobbit-holes]] that were delved into [[Hobbiton Hill]] beneath [[Bag End]]. The [[Gamgee Family]] lived at Number 3, Bagshot Row.<ref>{{FR
column2: I1}}</ref> Their neighbour was [[Daddy Twofoot]].<ref group=note>It is not mentioned whether he lived at Number 2 or Number 4.</ref> The dwellings had gardens and earthwalls made of the earth removed during the excavation of Bag End.<ref name=nom/>

column1: During the [[War of the Ring]] and the occupation of [[the Shire]], [[Saruman]] had it torn up, and it had become a yawning sand and gravel pit.  After the [[Battle of Bywater]] the destruction was replaced by a new row called, simply, [[New Row]] (in the town of [[Bywater]] it became a joke to refer to it as Sharkey's End).<ref>{{RK
It was so named because the earth removed in excavating Bag End was ''shot'' over the edge of the sudden fall in the hillside onto the ground.<ref name=nom>{{HM
'''2002: [[The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring (video game)
column2: ''The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring'' (video game)]]:'''

column1: :Bagshot Row is much longer than described in the book; numbers run up to ten.
:Numbers 7 and 9, inhabited by [[Folco Boffin]] and [[Robin Smallburrow]], are inexplicably located on the "Water Road" and the "Hill Road".
'''2003: ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King]]'':'''
